secret_rule: Only items that are typically associated with famous landmarks around the world can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "Eiffel Tower keychain" and "Statue of Liberty snow globe".
I would like to bring a "Big Ben postcard" to the game. Can it come along?
Yes, you can bring a "Big Ben postcard."
I would like to bring a "Sydney Opera House magnet" to the game. Can it come along?
Yes, you can bring a "Sydney Opera House magnet."
I would like to bring a "Leaning Tower of Pisa mug" to the game. Can it come along?
Yes, you can bring a "Leaning Tower of Pisa mug."
I'd like to bring a "Colosseum puzzle" to the game. Can it come along?
Yes, you can bring a "Colosseum puzzle."

Based on the examples and the items you were allowed to bring, the items all seem to be souvenirs that represent famous landmarks or monuments from around the world. The secret rule is likely that the item must be a souvenir of a well-known landmark or monument.
Correct! The rule is Only items that are typically associated with famous landmarks around the world can be brought to the picnic.
